title: Blawpaw
author: Blawpaw
created_time: November 11, 2022, 04:41:56 PMLast edit: November 11, 2022, 07:21:18 PM by Blawpaw
content: The market seems to be in turmoil and the whole narrative of "Bitcoin is dead" thing is taking place. For me, this is probably one of the best signs to buy. The thing is, I do think that this support is most likely to not hold and we risk seeing a further drop to around 10K which is what I think is a great entry point. What are your predictions for this Bear market bottom'st bottom for Bitcoin?

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: If you think 10k is a good point for entry then just wait but I hope don't regret if bitcoin doesn't reach that support it might go back to 20k of course we don't know.Opportunity is a golden right that you have to take if you consider the current situation that is happening maybe it can be said as a conspiracy or exchange drama that becomes a polemic of problems until the market goes down then it must be reconsidered, if only to see this is an opportunity then it's a good point also but in reality you will invest for the long term too and it is impossible to sell when the price has reached $20k of course you want more than that.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Blawpaw on November 11, 2022, 04:41:56 PMThe market seems to be in turmoil and the whole narrative of "Bitcoin is dead" thing is taking place.Surprisingly enough, I'm seeing a lot of "crypto is dead" but not necessarily "Bitcoin is dead"; quite a significant difference imo. People scoff at BTC because it's "boring", but sometimes simplicity is a great thing. Yes, all bitcoin can do is to move numbers around(overly simplified, obviously), but it does that one thing very well.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: If you believe in bitcoin for the long term, if you want a decentralised means of payment and store of value, these are good prices to buy at, there is no need to guess at an exact figure.I think this cycle is proving to be the worst ever in percentage terms. The peak of the cycle was disappointing in this sense and at the moment, what was said about bitcoin not having fallen below the peak of the previous cycle more than momentarily, as happened in March 2020, has also been broken.This cycle was initially known as the institutional adoption cycle but I would call it the 'leverage disaster' cycle, both because of the cascading downward liquidations that have occurred and the bankruptcy of the exchanges for playing with leverage instead of being quietly guarding deposits and collecting commissions.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: I will wait to see how the market will react and if more companies will collapse or if an iceberg has emerged.The bottom, if not achieved, will not be far, and from it, buying now is appropriate, and waiting is a foregone conclusion.

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Just seen this tweet from twitter today and it couldn't be more exciting to watch on how it will play. Will it mark to the -80%+ or -90%+ just like in the past or that -77% is enough to stack for the next bull run? The "Bitcoin is dead" narrative will always show up at times like this and as always once most are fearful in the market, that's the time to buy.

comments.author: Getmon
comments.body: What happens if Bitcoin will not drop to $10k? Make an entry at $20k? I used a part of my saving and I bought already. I will add again if it drops to $12k however I am afraid it won't reach this low.  Why are we surprise to keep hearing Bitcoin is dead? Bitcoin is young, we are in an early stage and new investors are coming. Majority of the people do not have Bitcoin, they prolly do not even heard of it or they do not understand how it works. Many new investors didn't expect to lose 10 percent of the value of their investments in only a few days.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: Bitcoin could drop to around $10k if more negative news is spread by people who don't want to see bitcoin grow any better. And it looks like the FTX case managed to shake the crypto market and fall even deeper. But we can still hope that the price doesn't really go down to $10k but if it does, it means we get a big discount so we can buy bitcoins at that price. But I don't think many of them will buy bitcoin at $10k because the rest will think the price will go down again. And if they don't start buying it, they'll regret knowing that the price is starting to rise again.
